text: The night is stillborn. Without sound or movement and nothing is in definition. A are degrees of blackness in this unlit world. The vague i of an African village in the void... a ragged line of tuk huts)... a bicycle propped against a mud wall... a soccer the dirt...
And we find a Sudanese family asleep on reed mats. A moth and their two boys. The younger boy we'll come to know as (9). His older brother "CHRISTOPHER" (12) curled next to

And slowly the blackness begins to shift... an otherworld seeping in from someplace far off... shadows contorting i orange flicker... images emerging... the silhouettes of m into this village carrying flaming torches.
The family still sound asleep, oblivious to the torch glo from outside, and suddenly --

The family bolts awake, moving to their feet as the door tukul SLAMS open -- THREE soldiers from the Lord's Resist (LRA) coming in carrying AK47's -- shouting in Arabic -- Get up!" -- the FATHER stepping forward -- holding up his "Don't shoot!" --

And he's gunned down in cold blood. The soldiers grab the boys and begin to drag them out of the tukul -- but WILLI free -- scrambles deeper into the room -- THE SOLDIER going after him -- WILLIAM darting behind a s storage boxes knocking them to the ground -- frantically into the corner -- trying to get away but it's useless -- SOLDIER grabs his feet and begins to pull him out -- WILL WILDLY -- digging his nails into the dirt -- and as he's of the corner he reaches out... inadvertently grabs a FAD PHOTOGRAPH which has fallen on the ground...
CHAOS! -- PANDEMONIUM! -- the black sky ablaze in apocaly 2

families yanked out of their burning tukuls by LRA rebels adult males of this village shot dead or bludgeoned to de women and children forced into the center of the village together and weeping -- -- and now we see WILLIAM hauled out -- his captor shouti another soldier -- pointing to WILLIAM'S mother and she's from the group and forced onto her knees... ... and WILLIAM is brought in front of her -- his captor something in Arabic as he hands him a club -- "Kill her!" shaking his head `no' -- tossing the club in the dirt and CRACKKK! -- WILLIAM is hit with the butt of a rifle -- go blood streaming down his face as he's pulled back up to h crying -- shaking with fear... ... and then he sees his mother staring up at him... and hell unfolding around them we see a moment here between m son... something calm and reassuring in the way she's loo now... her eyes full of love... and pity... for her child terrible moment... and before we see how this ends we --

text: And we see SAM CHILDERS coming down a corridor toward us, jailhouse orange and flanked by a guard. He's stocky, 32 with a biker's handlebar moustache. On the surface he app looking... even handsome if the light is right... but his tricky... always changing... behind the quick smile, arou eyes, in the taut muscles of his neck we see violence.

We see a CLERK handing Sam a prison issue tub full of his affects. He takes out his clothes, digs out a leather wal watch, some silver rings and a lighter. He looks up to the Clerk and flashes a malicious smile --
Ya'll go fuck yourself now, k? 3

A beat-up CHEVY VEGA parked at the curb. Sam's wife, LYNN a thrift store dress, leaning against the car, waiting. Sam (dressed in civilian clothes now) pushes out a door a him, straightens her hair, an uneasy smile. LYNN
Hey baby.

head_text.subj: EXT SIDE OF ROAD/INT. LYNN'S CAR

text: The Vega pulled of the side of the road and Sam fucking L back. There's nothing tender about what we're watching he finishes and Lynn slumps into the seat, pulls down her dr SAM
Gimme a smoke. LYNN
Don't got any. SAM
What, you quit? (LYNN NODS)
Shit, that ain't gonna last.

The Vega pulls up to a beat-to-shit single-wide and Sam a out. We see a homemade sign hanging outside the trailer t "Welcome Home Daddy!" And now Sam's daughter PAIGE (6) bursts out of the traile the steps... Followed by Sam's mother, DAISY, mid 60's, c the trailer. PAIGE
And she jumps into his arms. SAM
Hey bug... PAIGE
You see yer sign? Grandma and me made it this mornin. SAM
Yep, real nice. Lynn enters the trailer, Paige follows. 4 SAM (CONT'D)
How'ya doin, Mom? DAISY
Welcome home, Sam.
LYNN (TO PAIGE)
You excited, get some juice, help me set the table. Sam and Daisy enter. There's a quiet anxiety to this homecoming. Everybody on careful. LYNN (CONT'D)
Hope you're staying for supper. DAISY
Well, I didn't know if... SAM (TO LYNN)
What time you gotta work? Lynn hesitating, not sure how to answer... not sure what' happen when she does... finally... LYNN
I ain't on tonight. SAM
What? DAISY
(changing the subject) You know we could boil up that corn we got in there... SAM
Friday night you ain't on? Hell is that? He walks toward the fridge. LYNN
Paige, get that chair. SAM
That cocksucker Mark better be givin you yer time or I'm gonna go over there and bust in his teeth. Why ain't there no beer? 5 LYNN
I ain't dancin no more, Sam. He turns to her, studies her with cold eyes... LYNN (CONT'D)
Quit a couple weeks ago. Got a job over at Freemont. SAM
You tellin me the truth or is this a joke? LYNN
Pick up a second shift now and then. Weekends if I want em. It's good money. SAM
Good money? You stupid, woman? You quit strippin to pack fucking mushrooms at Freemont? DAISY
Sam... SAM
Mom, keep yer mouth shut. Sam's face changing, starting to turn bad. A look we'll c know. LYNN
They're good to me over there, Sam. They got daycare for Paige and I can get medical at the end of the year. SAM
Tell you what you're gonna do, you're goin back to The Bunny Hop and askin that cocksucker for yer old slot back... DAISY (TO PAIGE)
You ok? Let's ride our bikes outside. LYNN
No, Sam... SAM
Fuck you ain't. You gonna get that ass back up there and make yer tips. LYNN
It ain't right. 6 SAM
Fuck you talkin about? Daisy scooping up Paige and exiting, screen door slamming them and now Sam and Lynn are all alone. LYNN
I ain't dancin cause it ain't right in God's eyes. He don't want me doin that no more. SAM (LAUGHING)
You found god now, huh? That what this is? LYNN
He found me, and he's there for you too, baby. SAM
Don't gimme that bullshit. You a junkie stripper... LYNN
Not no more. God helped me change while you was away. Lynn reaches for him but he shoves her back violently... SAM
Gitcha hands off me! Sam exits. LYNN (TO HERSELF)
You can't keep goin the way you goin, baby...
Sam straddles the bike and kicks it to life. He PEELS OUT up gravel as he blasts past Paige and Daisy.
Sam riding down the road.

A tough biker bar in Johnstown, PA. A jukebox in the corn Lynard Skynard. Sam coming through the door, AD-LIBBED gr from some of the other bikers here. He makes his way to a where a hulking biker in a leather vest named DONNIE is s two girls. Donnie looks up, sees Sam... 7 DONNIE
Crazyhorse! There he is... They embrace, old friends. DONNIE (CONT'D)
Figured you'd be rollin out round now. How you doin, buddy? SAM
I'm doin. DONNIE
(to one of the girls) Get us a coupla shots and buds. (SAM SITS)
Don't look too worse for the wear. SAM
I'm alright. DONNIE
Heard yer old lady ain't at the Bunny Hop no more. SAM
Bitch found Jesus. DONNIE
Damn! That bearded sonuvagun slipped her the high holy dick while you was in the can, huh? Better him than the milk man, I guess. SAM
Ain't so sure bout that. Donnie laughs, slaps him on the shoulder... DONNIE
You wanna taste? Sam smiles that wicked smile and we go --
-- as a biker chick leads Sam down this hallway into --

Sam and the biker chick crammed into this dirty stall, Sk pounding through the walls. He rolls up his shirt sleeve cooks a spoon of methamphetamine... juices a hypodermic.. a vein and she spikes his arm... presses the plunger and rolls back on his shoulders... speed slamming into his bl as we RAMP UP THE MUSIC. 8

Snow piled up on the windowsills and it's cold as shit ou passed out on the couch and this guy looks like hell. Thinner than the last time we saw him, skin sallow and dr over his face. He stirs awake, sees Paige playing by hers floor next to him. She sees that he's awake, picks up her quietly goes outside without saying a word.

Sam coming in, taking a piss, staring at himself in the m we see a junkie map of track marks running up and down hi then WE HEAR a Pentecostal communion hymn, "the Old Rugge coming through... taking us to...
A congregation packed into this church for Sunday service Lynn and Paige in the crowd, singing along with the congr
Sam and Donnie in this car, parked in front of broken dow houses. Donnie pointing through the windshield... DONNIE
Right there. With the green light.
Bone chill cold. Sam and Donnie on this porch, scarves pu their necks, hands shoved into their jackets trying to st Donnie KNOCKING at the door... DONNIE
Hey, man, you there?! Open up... Donnie KNOCKING again and the door cracks an inch... and black man with a SHAVED HEAD on the other side looking ou SHAVED HEAD
Fuck are you? DONNIE
It's me, man, c'mon. Fuckin cold out here. SHAVED HEAD
I don't know you. DONNIE
Yeah you do, man. I saw you the other day. I'm Bobby's friend. 9 SHAVED HEAD
Who the fuck is Bobby? Suddenly Sam pulls a short barrel shotgun from his jacket MOSSBERG 10 GAGE -- presses it to the door and --
DOOR SPLINTERING OPEN! -- concussion like a fucking pipe wood splintering through the room like shrapnel -- Sam an STORMING IN... DONNIE

Don't fuckin move! INSTANT PANDEMONIUM! -- JUNKIES hopping off the couch, sc like rats deeper into the house -- SHAVED HEAD darting ou room -- Sam leveling the MOSSBERG in his direction -- BOOOM! -- the room flashing like a fucking supernova.
SHAVED HEAD scrambling up these stairs -- Sam coming up a hunting him -- MOSSBERG BLASTING in his direction -- BOOO
SHAVED HEAD sprinting down this hallway -- Sam tracking h b.g. -- bloodlust in his eyes -- leveling the MOSSBERG an
Shotgun slugs ripping through the house like cannon shot HEAD bolting through the smoke -- crashing through a door

-- SHAVED HEAD bombing in -- hitting the ground -- trying his feet but it's too late because -- -- SAM kicks open the door behind him -- SHAVED HEAD goin back, trying to crab crawl away from him but there's nowh Sam moving closer -- SHAVED HEAD
-- SHAVED HEAD working his way into a corner -- holding h front of his face -- terrified, shaking --
Donnie coming into the room -- SHAVED HEAD

head_text.subj: I'LL GIVE YOU WHAT YOU WANT, MAN

text: SAM
Tell me where the shit is or I'll blow yer nigger brains all over this floor. SHAVED HEAD
(indicating a closet) In there... Sam KICKS him toward the closet -- SAME
Hurry the fuck up. SHAVED HEAD crawling to a small safe in a closet, spins t opens it and pulls out six ounces of uncut cocaine. SAM

Cash! SHAVED HEAD grabs a stack of hundreds, hands it to Sam an CRACKKK! -- he SLAMS the butt of the Mossberg into SHAVED face and he hits the ground on his back -- Sam standing o shoves the barrel of the shotgun into his mouth -- DONNIE

C'mon, let's go! But Sam's not moving... just staring down at SHAVED HEAD. we're watching something here... a terrible intelligence over... something bloodless and inhuman coming over Sam i moment... and he chambers a slug into the shotgun... DONNIE (CONT'D)
Fuck are you doin?! And this is it. He's going to blow this guys brains all o floor... DONNIE (CONT'D)
Sam... His finger curls around the trigger, eyes becoming lethal DONNIE (CONT'D)
Sam! And he snaps back, looks around, sees Donnie standing the 11 DONNIE (CONT'D)
We need to get the fuck outta here!
MUSIC LOUD AS IT GOES! -- SCREAMING! -- Sam and Donnie pu celebrating after the robbery. Sam in the passenger seat, cooking coke in a bent spoon... SAM
See that nigger's face when I put it in his mouth? DONNIE

Cook that shit up, man! I wanna hit when I'm going a hundred miles an hour in this thing. Sam juices a needle and spikes Donnie's arm. Donnie feeli rush... pressing on the gas and howling like a wild man.. them wired out of their heads... BLASTING down this dark, road... and then they see... A HITCHHIKER
Up the road, standing in this bitter cold with his thumb SAM
Look at this sorry fucker...
Donnie's car pulls off the road and the Hitchhiker hustle
The Hitchhiker climbing into the backseat. He's late 40's drifter, probably American Indian. Donnie starts driving. SAM
Cold enough for ya out there, boy? DRIFTER
Yeah. DONNIE
Where you goin, man? DRIFTER
Dunshore. SAM
That's up there past Muncy, right? DRIFTER
Yeah. 12 DONNIE
We can take you far as McClure. DRIFTER
Take me to Dunshore. Sam looking back -- SAM

We ain't goin to Dunshore, boy. Said we can drop you at McClure. Suddenly -- silver flashing -- A BLADE -- out of nowhere into Donnie's neck from the backseat -- the Drifter pulli tight against the seat rest, pressing it into his throat DONNIE
What the fuck?! DRIFTER
Keep drivin! Dunshore or I'll cut his fuckin throat. SAM
Get that fuckin blade off him... Sam reaches his leg over and STOMPS ON THE GAS PEDDLE -- LURCHES forward -- accelerating -- DONNIE
Sam! DRIFTER

But Sam's not letting up... pressing down on the peddle h 90... 100... 110 mph -- Donnie YELLING -- trying to keep the road -- MUSIC BLARING -- like some wild ride to hell SAM SUDDENLY JUMPS IN THE BACKSEAT -- wrestling with the fighting wild -- elbowing him in the face and somehow the in his hand now -- and -- Stick, stick, stick, stick, stick, stick! He stabs him six times in the gut. The drifter HOWLING in
Donnie's car skidding off the shoulder of the road, back popping open and the Drifter's body dumped into the dirt. PEELS OUT, accelerates, tail lights disappearing into the 13
Lynn sound asleep in bed. And she slowly stirs awake, hea running from somewhere in the trailer.

Lynn moving down the hall... toward a sliver of light com under the closed bathroom door... gently pushing it open Sam standing at the sink... covered in blood... frantical to clean himself up... trying to wash the sin from his sk clothes but it's useless... and the sense we get is that staring at a man at the edge of an abyss... set to swallo whole... terrified... shaking... ... and now he realizes Lynn is here and he turns to her. up his stained hands... a terrible fear in his eyes when SAM
Help me.
Days later and we see Lynn and Paige, dressed up, sitting idling car, waiting. PAIGE
He comin or ain't he? LYNN
I don't know.

And we find Sam in this bedroom all alone, wearing a thri sportcoat, sitting on the edge of the bed. Frozen. Starin stocking feet and three or four pairs of workboots scatte floor. Lynn steps into the doorway...
Honey? You ready? Sam turns to her, and he looks lost here. Like a little b SAM
I don't got no good shoes, Lynn. And she comes into the room, sits on the bed next to him, arm around his shoulder. LYNN
He don't care what kinda shoes you wearin, baby. 14

Packed with Sunday families listening to Pastor Krause at pulpit. Behind him we see a BAPTISMAL TANK filled with wa now we see Sam, Lynn, Paige, and Daisy sitting near the b looks uncomfortable, on edge. PASTOR KRAUSE
The point of receiving God's word is life. Life upon life. And to accept the blood of Jesus is life upon life upon life... CONGREGATION
Praise be to God! PASTOR KRAUSE
He breathes his spirit into darkness and makes something good. He sees our shadow and says, `let there be light!" CONGREGATION
Amen! PASTOR KRAUSE
... now proclaim his saving grace! If there are sinners here looking for God raise your hands! A few hands shoot up --

Stand up! Receive Jesus Christ as your light and saviour... Three or four people moving to their feet, making their w the altar. Lynn turns to Sam, their eyes meet. He looks h unsure. She gives him a reserved little smile, nods her h slightly as if saying "you can do this"... And in her look he finds strength, gets up, slowly makes to... FRONT ALTAR
And now we see Sam on his knees in the baptismal tank. Th almost up to his waist. Pastor Krause kneeling behind him

Receive Jesus as your Lord and Saviour... in the name of the father and of the son and of the Holy Ghost... ... and he leans Sam back, cradling his head as he submer the water completely... and when Sam comes back up the ch into ROWDY HALLELUJAHS!... and we see Lynn... tears in he 15
clapping in the back row... and an organist and singer be "Amazing Grace" taking us to... OMITTED

Months later and the snow has thawed... it's summer... an Sam with other CONSTRUCTION WORKERS finishing their day, their tools, cleaning up. We notice that his gaunt cheeks filled out and he looks healthier. And now a CONTRACTOR comes up to Sam, hands him a check. CONTRACTOR
Thanks for your help, Sam. SAM
You need me to stay on, I can. CONTRACTOR
We're movin inside next week. SAM
I can drywall, tile, whatever you got. Know my way round some electrical too. CONTRACTOR
Sorry, Sam, I gotta cut the crew. Just ain't enough work.
Sam alone on these steps, lost in thought. Screen door op Lynn comes out, sits next to him. SAM
She asleep? LYNN
Think so, in our bed... she's funny. BEAT. SAM
Job's done. LYNN
I thought that was goin through August? Sam shakes his head, and they're quiet... both of them si on these steps... the burden of this life catching up to this moment. 16
A WOMAN stares down at her desk with a frown, shaking her sitting in a small chair in front of her. WOMAN
I got somethin in Pitt, but you gotta have some college for that. SAM
I'm a hard worker and I learn real fast. WOMAN
But you got no education, Mr. Childers.
And we see Sam standing next to his Harley, talking to a MECHANIC
... don't deal bikes. Probably have a better shot if you take it over to Pitt. Or maybe down to Philly. SAM
I gotta sell it today. MECHANIC
Give you four hundred for it. SAM
There's almost two grand on this bike. Them pipes right there is custom. You wont see pipes like that on anything round here. MECHANIC
Like I said, don't deal bikes. I'll give you four-twenty. Cash. Best I can do.
Sam on the edge of Paige's bed reading her a CHILDREN'S B SAM (READING)
"Into the street the Piper stept, smiling first a little smile, then three shrill notes the pipe uttered like a great and mighty army muttered..." PAIGE
What's uttered? SAM
Like spoke up, made a sound. 17 PAIGE
Okay, keep goin. SAM

(turns the page) And out of the houses the rats came tumblin, black rats, brown rats, brother rats, sister rats, and husband rats followed their little rat wives... Til they came to the ragin water where they drowned and lost their lives." PAIGE
They got rid all them rats? SAM
Yep. PAIGE
How come you sold yer Harley? SAM
Cause it's what I had to do. Off her look... SAM (CONT'D)
We're gonna be ok, bug, don't you worry. Paige curls into him closer, and we're watching him here. moment... holding his daughter... not so sure they're gon

location: THE CROSSROADS BAR PARKING LOT/INT. LYNN'S CAR

text: CLOSE ON Sam, behind the wheel of the car, parked, starin front windshield. REVERSE to see he's in the parking lot just watching the entrance.
Empty except for a handful of regulars. Sam coming throug taking in the place, the fucking grime and despair. Movin who is sitting in his same spot... DONNIE
Well, well, well, wondered when I was gonna see you again, ole buddy. How you doin? Sam sits. SAM
I'm doin. DONNIE
Heard you was followin the Lord now. 18 SAM
Lil' bit. Donnie sizes him up, "how much is a little bit?", turns t BARTENDER... DONNIE
Jackie, gimme a mash and bud... (TO SAM)
You want somethin? Sam shakes his head. DONNIE (CONT'D)

You know that old Indian didn't die out there that night. Story in the Lehigh Valley News bout it. Somebody picked that poor bastard up after us, took him to the emergency room, you believe that shit? SAM
God was lookin out for us both, I suppose. WAITRESS slides a shot and beer in front of Donnie... DONNIE
Well then, here's to him. (DRINKS)
Didn't hear you pull up. SAM
Got Lynn's car. DONNIE
She broke down on ya? SAM
Sold her. DONNIE
Ahhh, shit, man. Shoulda come to yer ole buddy first. Donnie smiling, inviting him back into this world. And we watching Sam, threshold moment here, considering.
It's late and we see Lynn sitting at the kitchen table al has not come home and she is clearly worried. And then we pulling up outside, door opening and closing, and Sam com the trailer. SAM
Sorry I'm late. 19

Lynn staring at him, trying to read this man's face but h looking at her. Avoiding her gaze. Did he use? Is he high she sees a PINPRICK OF DRIED BLOOD on his shirtsleeve. He contorting almost imperceptibly. Her worst fear realized. And she moves to him without saying a word... lifts up hi unbuttons the cuff of his shirt... slowly pushing up his to discover a NEEDLE PRICK in his arm... ... and then he pulls out a $20 bill and hands it to her. SAM (CONT'D)
Gave blood over in Pitt. Lynn searching his eyes and she knows he's telling the tr SAM (CONT'D)
That's all I got. And she pulls him close, hugging him tight, grateful. LYNN
Somethin will come through. I promise. And we hold on Sam, his troubled eyes. Completely out of And we see that for this man the inability to provide for is crushing.
HEAVY WINDS! -- FLASHES OF LIGHTENING! -- a storm startin the trailer park.
Lynn in front of the TV, scared, watching an EMERGENCY WE WARNING... winds buffeting the trailer... Sam coming into from the back... LYNN
Two touched down near Harrisberg.
Sam opening the door, coming down the steps, looking up t and it is fucking black, swirling, ominous.
Sam coming back into the trailer fast -- SAM
Come on! Let's go... Lynn following him -- 20
-- down the hallway -- WIND PICKING UP -- starting to roc trailer back and forth. SAM
Get Paige, grab a blanket. -- Lynn darting into a bedroom, scooping Paige out of her
Sam coming in, moving to a metal gun locker in the corner room, pulling out a SHOTGUN.
THE WIND -- SLAMMING the trailer now -- Lynn and Paige -- - watching as Sam moves to the center of the room, points of the shotgun toward the floor and --
Blows four gaping holes in the floorboards, then starts t through the wood with his boot -- LYNN
(yelling, over the wind) What are you doing?! He kicks a hole in the planks, turns to Lynn and Paige -- SAM

Paige crawling through the opening... into a shallow tren underneath the trailer... Lynn squeezing in behind her... staying outside... no room for him... the trailer startin VIOLENTLY in the tempest... thin walls contorting around ... and Paige starts to cry -- terrified -- Sam laying do floor next to the opening, close enough so she can hear h SAM (CONT'D)
Bug, you hear me?! -- Bug?! PAIGE
Yeah. And he starts to play a child's word association game wit something she knows... something they've played before... SAM
I'm thinkin of a snail... you hear me, Bug?! Snail. 21
And we hear her tiny little voice say... PAIGE
Whale. SAM
Good job, Bug, good job! You said whale, I'm thinkin of a pail! PAIGE
You said pail, I'm thinkin of a tail. And so this little game goes between father and daughter. listening to his voice... in the midst of this terrible s somehow becoming less terrified.

A brilliantly clear day and we see neighbors picking up a storm. Sam on a ladder leaning against the trailer, naili strip of bent aluminum as a pickup truck pulls up. Window and we see it's the CONTRACTOR from before. CONTRACTOR
Sam. SAM
Billy. CONTRACTOR

Yep. Sam climbs down, moves to the truck, shakes his hand. CONTRACTOR

We're alright. CONTRACTOR
